title: Six aircraft diverted due to adverse weather at BIA
byline: Six aircraft have been diverted to the Mattala International Airport and Thiruvananthapuram International Airport in India due to the heavy rains around the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA).

title: Five children missing after tractor swept away in floodwaters
byline: Seven individuals, including five children have gone missing after the tractor they were in was swept away by floodwaters today

title: All spills gates of major reservoirs opened
byline: All spill gates of the Deduru Oya, Rathkinda Reservoirs, Polgolla Diversion Dam, Rajanganaya Reservoir, Iranamadu Tank, Ulhitiya Reservoir and Parakrama Samudra have been opened due to the heavy rainfall in these areas.

title: One dead, over 70,000 affected due to heavy rains
byline: Due to the heavy rainfall across the country, 77,670 persons belonging to 22,532 families have been affected, with one death reported, the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) said.

title: Landslide warning issued for ten districts
byline: The National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) today (26) issued early landslide warnings for ten districts.

title: A/L exams suspended for three days
byline: The Examinations Department has decided to suspend the 2024 GCE Advanced Level (A/L) examinations on November 27, 28 and 29 due to the prevailing adverse weather conditions.

title: Sri Lanka Economic Summit in January 2025
byline: The 24th edition of the Sri Lanka Economic Summit, organised by the Ceylon Chamber of Commerce, will take place on January 28 and 29, at Shangri La Hotel, Colombo.

title: Amarapura Chapter gets new Mahanayake Thero
byline: Most Venerable Karagoda Uyangoda Maithri Murthi Thero has been appointed as the Mahanayake Thero of the Amarapura Nikaya.

title: Badulla night mail train cancelled
byline: The night mail train scheduled to depart from Colombo Fort to Badulla has been cancelled due to the prevailing adverse weather conditions, the Railways Department said

title: Several wildlife tourism bungalows closed due to adverse weather
byline: Steps have been taken to close the wildlife tourist bungalows located in the Yala and Wasgamuwa National Parks due to the current adverse weather and flood conditions prevailing in the country, the Wildlife Conservation Department said.

title: Bribery Commission records statement from Maithripala Sirisena
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery and Corruption recorded a statement from former MP Maithripala Sirisena today.

title: Immigration authorities nab 26 foreigners from Colombo call center
byline: The Department of Immigration and Emigration apprehended 26 foreign nationals this morning, who have been allegedly engaged in an illegal call center in Colombo.

title: Another court case against Arjuna Aloysius
byline: A case has been filed before the Colombo Magistrate’s Court, alleging that Arjuna Aloysius, the director of W.M.Mendis and Company, who is currently serving a six-month prison sentence for tax evasion, defrauded Rs. 12 million by purchasing paper for printing a newspaper.

title: NPP General Secretary’s vehicle falls into Parliament pond
byline: The motor vehicle of General Secretary of the National People’s Power and MP for Kalutara District Dr. Nihal Abeysinghe fell into the Parliament complex pond last evening.

title: Deep Depression to turn into a cyclone today more rain expected - Met. Dept.
byline: The deep depression that has developed in the Bay of Bengal is expected to convert into a cyclone by today but will have only a minimum effect on Sri Lanka, Department of Meteorology said yesterday.

title: Accountant arrested for stealing handbag at BIA
byline: An accountant was arrested yesterday for stealing the handbag of a 55-year-old Sri Lankan office assistant who works in London after she arrived at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) from London.

title: Adverse weather claims four lives; six reported missing
byline: Four people have so far lost their lives and six others remain missing due to the severe weather conditions currently affecting the island, Director General of the Disaster Management Center Major General (Rtd) Udaya Herath said.

title: Deep depression will convert to a cyclonic storm by 6 p.m
byline: The deep depression over the south-west Bay of Bengal will intensify into a cyclonic storm by 6 pm today, Meteorology Department’s Director General, Athula Karunanayake said.

title: Muslim schools in Central Province to remain closed due to bad weather
byline: The Ministry of Education in the Central Province has announced the temporary closure of all Muslim schools and pre-schools in the region from November 27 to November 29.

title: Night mail trains on Upcountry Line cancelled
byline: In light of the severe weather conditions, the Railway Department has announced the cancellation of all night mail train services on the Upcountry railway line for today.

title: Namal praises armed forces’ rescue efforts;  urges govt. to assist flood victims
byline: While expressing regret over the tragic incident in the East last evening, where a tractor carrying children was swept away by floodwaters, SLPP MP Namal Rajapaksa praised the efforts of the armed forces, who are at the forefront of rescue operations in flood-affected districts across the country.

title: SPC Chairman Dr. Arjuna Thilakarathne assigned to Health Ministry
byline: Senior Medical Administrator and Chairman of the State Pharmaceuticals Corporation (SPC), Dr. Arjuna Thilakarathne has been assigned to the Health Ministry, sources said.

title: Over 200,000 people affected across 17 districts
byline: A total of 207,582 people from 59,269 families have been affected across 17 districts due to the ongoing heavy rains, according to the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) report.

title: Deep depression near Sri Lanka to intensify into cyclone during next 12 hours
byline: The deep depression over the southwest Bay of Bengal is likely to move closer to the east coast of Sri Lanka and intensify into a cyclonic storm within the next 12 hours, the Meteorology Department said.

title: World’s oldest man dies aged 112
byline: The world’s oldest living man has died at the age of 112, his family have confirmed.

title: Ministry warns of flood risks in low-lying areas of Parakrama Samudra
byline: The Secretary of the Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock, Land and Irrigation, D.P. Wickremasinghe, has urged residents in the low-lying areas of the Parakrama Samudra to remain vigilant against sudden flooding.

title: Adani Group says it lost nearly $55 billion since U.S. corruption charges
byline: The Adani Group conglomerate said Wednesday (November 27,) it had suffered a staggering loss of nearly $55 billion since U.S. corruption charges against top officials, accusations the company denies.

title: 8 still missing after tractor swept away in floodwaters: Child’s body found
byline: Search operations are still underway to locate eight people, including five children, who went missing after the tractor they were travelling in was swept away by floodwaters yesterday in Karaitivu, Batticaloa, police said.

title: Israel-Hezbollah ceasefire comes into effect
byline: A ceasefire following more than a year of fighting between Israel and Hezbollah in Lebanon has come into effect.

title: Flooding closes A9 road to Jaffna at Omanthai
byline: Heavy rainfall across the country has caused flooding on the A9 main road to Jaffna at Omanthai, prompting police to advise motorists to use alternate routes, the Police said.

title: Finger millet, baby shrimp with fake labels seized in Kotahena
byline: A large stock of Finger Millet (Kurakkan) and Baby Shrimp was seized by officers of the Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) from a warehouse in Kotahena. The stock was being prepared for release to the market with altered labels indicating false manufacturing and expiry dates.

title: Phoebe Litchfield and Chamari Athapaththu key to Thunder’s win in WBBL knockout
byline: The Hobart Hurricanes sneaked into the final four courtesy of a three-wicket win in their final league game of the Women’s Big Bash League (WBBL) 10 to knock the Scorchers out of contention. Sydney Thunder led by skipper Phoebe Litchfield finished 3rd on the points table with 13 points from 10 games in the league stages. They were the designated hosts of the knockout game against the Hobart Hurricanes as they finished 3rd in the points table.

title: Two new ministry secretaries appointed
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has appointed two new Secretaries to the Ministry of Environment and Ministry of Science and Technology, President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: Australia assures technical support to Sri Lanka’s national security, maritime affairs
byline: Australia has expressed its potential technical support in areas such as national security, maritime affairs, digitalization, public sector modernization, vocational education, and the energy sector in Sri Lanka.

title: Date of A/L recommencement to be announced after assessing weather situation
byline: The Examinations Department will announce the date of the recommencement of the Advance Level (A/L) examination after assessing the weather situation after November 29, Defence Secretary Air Vice Marshal Sampath Thuyacontha said

title: Address difficulties faced by A/L students: President tells education officials
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake advised education officials to take appropriate measures to ensure the mental well-being and address difficulties faced by students sitting for the Advanced Level examinations amid the adverse weather conditions.
